revised_title: The Role of Air-Bladder and Extrinsic Muscles in Sound Production in Siluroid Fishes
tldr: This article investigates the production of sounds by certain siluroid fishes, specifically examining the role of the air-bladder and extrinsic muscles. The authors conclude that sounds are produced by the vibration of air within the air-bladder, rather than the expulsion of air through the ductus pneumaticus, and that the 'elastic spring' mechanism and paired extrinsic muscles are structures subordinate to sound production.
